name: weaponized
description: This is the vscode extension designed for esonhugh/weaponizedvscode project.

commands.title: Setup/Create/Init weaponized vscode folder in current workspace

weaponized.lhost.description: This is the LHOST setting for weaponized vscode extension. it's for receive reverse shell or prompt reverse links.

weaponized.lport.description: This is the LPORT setting for weaponized vscode extension. it's for receive reverse shell or prompt reverse links.

weaponized.listenon.description: This is the listen port for weaponized vscode extension. it's for listening webserver requests.

weaponized.envs.description: This is the extra environment variables for weaponized vscode extension. it will be used in the commands and tasks. you can add your own environment variables here, like {"MY_VAR": "my_value"}. it will be used in the commands/tasks/terminals.

weaponized.user_vars.description: This is the user defined variables for weaponized vscode extension. it will be used in the commands and tasks. you can add your own variables here, like {"MY_VAR": "my_value"}. it will be used in the commands and tasks. refer this like ${config:weaponized.user_vars.MY_VAR} in the commands/tasks.

weaponized.hashcat.description: Path to hashcat executable. it will be used in the hashcat task.

weaponized.netcat.description: This is the netcat command for weaponized vscode extension. it contains the netcat command with ${LPORT} as placeholder. u can replace with pwncat-cs or other shell handlering tools

weaponized.webdelivery.description: This is the web delivery command for weaponized vscode extension. it contains the web delivery command with ${LISTEN_ON} or ${config:weaponized.listenon} as placeholder. u can replace with other web delivery tools like python3 http.server or php -S 0.0.0.0:${LISTEN_ON}

weaponized.msf.resourcefile.description: Path to msfconsole resource file. if it doesn't exist, it will be ignored in msfconsole.

weaponized.scanners.description: This is the scanner configurations for weaponized vscode extension. it will be used in the scanner tasks. you can add your own scanner configurations here, like {"nmap": "nmap -sS -sV -O -Pn -p- -T4 --script vuln $TARGET"}. it will be used in the scanner tasks.

weaponized.terminal-log.enabled.description: Enable terminal logging for weaponized vscode extension. it will log the terminal output to the ${config:weaponized.terminal-log.path} file.

weaponized.terminal-log.path.description: Path to the terminal log file for weaponized vscode extension. it will be used to log the terminal output.

weaponized.terminal-log.level.description: Terminal log level for weaponized vscode extension. it can be 'command-only', 'command-and-output'. 'command-only' will only log the command, 'command-and-output' will log the command and the its output.

scripts.pretest: pnpm run compile-tests && pnpm run compile && pnpm run lint
